{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "353dec0c-4891-4df6-9eee-416c79e46f5c",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# BaZrO3:Ti study"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "81800feb-ca94-42fc-9075-e519c2349344",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "This section present a short overview of the use of the main features of Hylight, applied a the system $BaZrO_3:Ti$.\n",
    "The synthesis and luminescence characterization of the doped material showed a blue luminescence that we tried to simulate.\n",
    "The cell used was a 3x3x3 supercell of the conventional cell of $BaZrO_3$ in which one $Zr$ atom was substituted with a $Ti$ atom.\n",
    "All computations were performed with VASP."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "bcd7131f-573e-4085-8165-28d4eb1b774e",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Preliminaries\n",
    "Here are some utility functions and import that will be used throughout the study."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 20,
   "id": "b53b772e-de62-4f26-8e49-fb0782b00c34",
   "metadata": {
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "%matplotlib inline"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 21,
   "id": "03909884-d1d7-4b94-994f-88f887894dd6",
   "metadata": {
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "from hylight.constants import *\n",
    "import logging\n",
    "\n",
    "logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.INFO)  # setting the logging level to INFO"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 22,
   "id": "3722a45d-1150-4530-96d6-864d6cb3c3e3",
   "metadata": {
    "jupyter": {
     "source_hidden": true
    },
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Helper functions to deal with experimental spectrum\n",
    "\n",
    "def best_max(raw_x, raw_y, f=0.95):\n",
    "    \"Fit a 2nd order polynom to get a position of the maximum without the noise.\"\n",
    "    guess = np.max(raw_y)\n",
    "\n",
    "    y = raw_y[raw_y > f * guess]\n",
    "    x = raw_x[raw_y > f * guess]\n",
    "    \n",
    "    x1, x2, x3, x4 = np.mean(x**1), np.mean(x**2), np.mean(x**3), np.mean(x**4)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    x2y = np.mean(x**2 * y)\n",
    "    xy = np.mean(x * y)\n",
    "    my = np.mean(y)\n",
    "\n",
    "    A = np.array([[x4, x3, x2],\n",
    "                  [x3, x2, x1],\n",
    "                  [x2, x1, 1.]])\n",
    "\n",
    "    B = np.array([[x2y, xy, my]]).transpose()\n",
    "\n",
    "    alpha, beta, gamma = np.linalg.solve(A, B)[:, 0]\n",
    "    \n",
    "    return -0.5 * beta / alpha, gamma - 0.25 * beta**2 / alpha\n",
    "    \n",
    "def load_exp(path, sep=\";\", skip=0):\n",
    "    exp = np.loadtxt(path,\n",
    "                     delimiter=sep,\n",
    "                    skiprows=skip)\n",
    "    x, y = eV1_in_nm / exp[:, 0], exp[:, 1]\n",
    "    xmax, ymax = best_max(x, y)\n",
    "    y /= ymax\n",
    "    return x, y, xmax\n",
    "\n",
    "def select_interval(x, y, emin, emax, norm=True, npoints=None):\n",
    "    slice_ = (x > emin) * (x < emax)\n",
    "    xs, ys = x[slice_], y[slice_] / (np.max(y[slice_]) if norm else 1.)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    if npoints is not None:\n",
    "        emin = max(np.min(xs), emin)\n",
    "        emax = min(np.max(xs), emax)\n",
    "        xint = np.linspace(emin, emax, npoints)\n",
    "        return xint, interp1d(xs, ys)(xint)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    return xs, ys"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "a2f7e56b-dd53-4628-812b-7a8d0c46df2e",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "To perform the simulation of the spectrum of BaZrO3:Ti we need a few pieces of information.\n",
    "The following diagram shows the four points A, B, C and D that need to be computed in DFT.\n",
    "We used constrained DFT to compute B and C with an explicit hole in the VBM and an electron in the CBM.\n",
    "The cDFT and the regular DFT computations provides us with total energies and the positions $R_G$ and $R_E$ that we will use as inputs in the next section.\n",
    "\n",
    "![figure_1](./energy_diagram.png \"Figure 1: Investigated electronic states\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "da8223c3-e108-477b-bb62-368a4258037d",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Given the geometry $R_G$ we also perform a DFPT computation to get the eigen values and eigenvectors of the dynamical matrix, that is we get the $\\Gamma$ vibrational modes of the crystal.\n",
    "\n",
    "The modes are extracted from the VASP output file and stored in the `OUTCAR.npz` with the command line tool `hylight-modes`:\n",
    "```sh\n",
    "$ hylight-modes vasp OUTCAR OUTCAR.npz\n",
    "Loaded 405 modes from OUTCAR.\n",
    "Wrote OUTCAR.npz.\n",
    "```"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "cbfe6dd1-ae11-4953-b025-c62c10069a2d",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Electronic and vibrational parameters"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "5c3702ed-ef20-4b6e-9c79-a9a37bf65453",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Here we declare the inputs that will be used later."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 23,
   "id": "16974002-83f7-456c-8b68-0aebabc19646",
   "metadata": {
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Adiabatic energy difference: 2.971 eV\n",
      "Vertical energy difference: 2.684 eV\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fc_shift_es = 0.1091  # B-C\n",
    "fc_shift_gs = 0.2871  # D-A\n",
    "e_adia = 2.970886  # C-A\n",
    "\n",
    "e_vert = e_adia - fc_shift_gs  # C-D\n",
    "\n",
    "outcar = \"OUTCAR.npz\"  # vibrations\n",
    "poscar_gs = \"POSCAR_GS\"  # R_G\n",
    "poscar_es = \"POSCAR_S1\"  # R_E\n",
    "T = 300  # measure temperature (K)\n",
    "\n",
    "print(f\"Adiabatic energy difference: {e_adia:0.3f} eV\")\n",
    "print(f\"Vertical energy difference: {e_vert:0.3f} eV\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "dbdab399-f01f-4d3f-af38-0755792a4b0b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Vibrational properties investigation"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "5f0f7863-9562-4a04-b061-b02a966af89a",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We now plot the spectral function to identify important modes."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 25,
   "id": "3e42857a-47d0-4f59-af77-00d250ad8da8",
   "metadata": {
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 900x700 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from hylight.multi_phonons import plot_spectral_function\n",
    "\n",
    "fig, (ax_fc, ax_s) = plot_spectral_function(outcar, poscar_gs, poscar_es, use_cm1=True, disp=5e-1, mpl_params={\n",
    "    \"S_stack\": {\"color\": \"orange\"},\n",
    "    \"FC_stack\": {\"color\": \"orange\"},\n",
    "    \"S_peaks\": {\"color\": \"blue\", \"lw\": 1.5},\n",
    "    \"FC_peaks\": {\"color\": \"blue\", \"lw\": 1.5},\n",
    "})\n",
    "\n",
    "ax_fc.set_ylabel(\"$d_{FC,j}$ (meV)\")\n",
    "ax_s.set_ylabel(\"$S_j$ (A. U.)\")\n",
    "plt.tight_layout()\n",
    "fig.set_size_inches((9, 7))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "c94861aa-ed3f-408f-8084-78a36d89ed6e",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "There is obsivously one very dominant mode. We can export it to a Jmol file to visualize it."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 40,
   "id": "a6e3f4eb-7e59-448f-aacc-55edb1d58570",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Degenerated modes: 1\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from hylight.loader import load_phonons\n",
    "from hylight.multi_phonons import compute_delta_R\n",
    "\n",
    "delta_R = compute_delta_R(poscar_gs, poscar_es) * 1e-10  # careful, Mode.huang_rhys expects SI units\n",
    "modes, _, _ = load_phonons(outcar)\n",
    "\n",
    "big_modes = [m for m in modes if m.huang_rhys(delta_R) > 2]\n",
    "print(\"Degenerated modes:\", len(big_modes))\n",
    "\n",
    "from hylight.jmol import export\n",
    "\n",
    "mode = big_modes[0]\n",
    "export(\n",
    "    \"big_mode.jmol\",\n",
    "    mode,\n",
    "    scale=5.0,\n",
    "    unitcell=mode.lattice,  # show the unitcell as a box\n",
    "    bonds = [  # bonds to show, with length between 0 and 2.2 A\n",
    "        (\"Zr\", \"O\", 0, 2.2),\n",
    "        (\"Ti\", \"O\", 0, 2.2),\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    atom_colors = [  # colors to show atoms\n",
    "        (\"Ba\", \"green\"),\n",
    "        (\"Zr\", \"blue\"),\n",
    "        (\"Ti\", \"grey\"),\n",
    "        (\"O\", \"red\"),\n",
    "    ],\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "1ec29dc5-d47f-4d4a-940a-6f68dff81fb6",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Here is the result in Jmol:\n",
    "\n",
    "![big_mode_jmol.png](./big_mode_jmol.png)\n",
    "\n",
    "We can clearly see that the mode is a pure respiration mode of the $TiO_6$ with the $O_h$ symmetry."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "e5f3313d-c5f7-4937-b09a-1b4134183920",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Line width approximation"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "ff948554-d48e-4463-a006-6d6917e46a42",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We now will use a semi-classical model to approximate the width of the band.\n",
    "The specific model for the width is a 1D reduction of the system, and the effective vibration frequency is computed as a mean over FC shifts."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 26,
   "id": "72d62d69-970b-46dd-89ef-d1fcfa83a624",
   "metadata": {
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "S = 3.4298721572871944\n",
      "d_fc^e,v = 0.08390772346494868\n",
      "ex_fwhm = 0.4905400232911907 eV\n",
      "Using a Gaussian line shape.\n",
      "Guessed line FWHM = 468.5 meV\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from hylight.guess_width import guess_width, OmegaEff, WidthModel\n",
    "\n",
    "width = guess_width(outcar, (poscar_gs, poscar_es), fc_shift_gs, fc_shift_es, T, omega_eff_type=OmegaEff.FC_MEAN, width_model=WidthModel.ONED)\n",
    "print(f\"Guessed line FWHM = {width*1e3:0.1f} meV\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "2e4ed818-402f-492b-93eb-aa2a4e46a901",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Spectrum simulation"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "a80b9020-07b8-473f-8d86-a947d232e32a",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Finally, taking vibrational and electronic parameters into account we simulate the spectrum."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 27,
   "id": "a98741e5-fc63-4c69-83da-dac7b73c99dd",
   "metadata": {
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Total Huang-Rhys factor 3.4298721572871944.\n",
      "Using a Gaussian line shape.\n",
      "Computed maximum of emission: 2.82 eV\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from hylight.multi_phonons import compute_spectrum\n",
    "\n",
    "e, sp = compute_spectrum(  # simulate the spectrum\n",
    "    outcar,\n",
    "    (poscar_gs, poscar_es),\n",
    "    e_adia,\n",
    "    width,\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "_, max_th = max(zip(sp, e))  # extract the maximum of emission energy\n",
    "print(f\"Computed maximum of emission: {max_th:.3} eV\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "bec4c117-4c5a-458e-867c-8e52699059e7",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Plotting"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "31342b81-f788-4e51-8896-2f8cbdcac831",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Here we load the experimental data that will be used for comparision with the simulation."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 24,
   "id": "b96d67ae-8363-48de-a7de-80a2866af8a2",
   "metadata": {
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Measured maximum of emission: 2.62 eV\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "exp_e, exp_i, max_emission = load_exp(\"lum_BaZrO3_277nm_220518_corr.csv\")\n",
    "\n",
    "print(f\"Measured maximum of emission: {max_emission:.3} eV\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "63fb47b1-3338-4601-aae7-8338030408f9",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Finally we setup a plot to show the result of the simulation against the measurement."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 28,
   "id": "7655ee14-7f57-494a-922e-697fbe8a279e",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 900x700 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "plt.figure(figsize=(9, 7))\n",
    "\n",
    "e, sp = e[1:], sp[1:]\n",
    "exp_e, exp_i = exp_e[1:], exp_i[1:]\n",
    "plt.plot(exp_e, exp_i, \"b\", lw=3, label=\"Experiment\")\n",
    "plt.plot(e, sp, \":\", color=\"b\", lw=3, label=f\"Simulation (T = {T} K)\")\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.xlim(1.7, 4)\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"Energie (eV)\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"Emission intensity (A. U.)\")\n",
    "\n",
    "ax = plt.gca()\n",
    "np.seterr(divide='ignore')  # there is a division by zero occuring in the next line but it is irrelevant for our xlim\n",
    "secax = ax.secondary_xaxis('top', functions=(lambda x: eV1_in_nm / x, lambda x: eV1_in_nm / x))\n",
    "secax.set_xlabel(\"$\\lambda$ (nm)\")\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.tight_layout()\n",
    "leg = plt.legend(prop={\"size\": 20})\n",
    "plt.savefig(\"bzo_spectra.png\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "6c4f3e03-6a5d-457b-a2a3-f8a0e14cc61d",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "It appears that the simulated transition matches the shoulder on the right of the measured band.\n",
    "We believe that the left part of the band is the result of the luminescence of a different defect that we have not investigated."
   ]
  }
 ],
